sen.j: 京北町（けいほくちょう）は、2005年3月31日まで京都府北桑田郡に存在した町。
sen.e: Keihoku-cho was a town which existed in Kitakuwada-gun, Kyoto Prefecture until March 31, 2005.
Keihoku Town was a town which existed in Kitakuwada-gun, Kyoto Prefecture until March 31, 2005.
Keihoku Town was a town which existed in Kitakuwada-gun, Kyoto Prefecture until March 31, 2005.

sen.j: 現在の京都市右京区の一部であり、町名に京北を冠する区域にあたる。
sen.e: It was a part of current Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, and consisted of areas whose place names have the prefix "Keihoku".
It was a part of current Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, and consisted of areas whose place names have the prefix 'Keihoku.'
It was a part of current Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, and consisted of areas whose place names have the prefix 'Keihoku.'

sen.j: 1955年3月1日に北桑田郡南部の1町5村（周山町・細野村・宇津村・黒田村・山国村・弓削村）が合併して発足。
sen.e: It was formed on March 1, 1955 by the merging of a town and five villages (Shuzan-cho, Hosono-mura, Utsu-mura, Kuroda-mura, Yamaguni-mura and Yuge-mura) in the southern part of Kitakuwada-gun.

It was formed on March 1, 1955 by the merging of a town and five villages (Shuzan Town, Hosono Village, Utsu Village, Kuroda Village, Yamaguni Village and Yuge Village) in the southern part of Kitakuwada-gun.

It was formed on March 1, 1955 by the merging of a town and five villages (Shuzan Town, Hosono Village, Utsu Village, Kuroda Village, Yamaguni Village and Yuge Village) in the southern part of Kitakuwada-gun.

sen.j: 町名は公募のなかから決められた。
sen.e: The town name was elected from among the ideas which were sought from the public.
The town name was elected from among the ideas which were sought from the public.
The town name was elected from among the ideas which were sought from the public.

sen.j: 1957年4月1日に町内の大字広河原が京都市左京区に編入。
sen.e: Oaza Hirokawara in the town was absorbed into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City on April 1, 1957.
Oaza Hirokawara in the town was absorbed into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City on April 1, 1957.
Oaza Hirokawara in the town was absorbed into Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City on April 1, 1957.

sen.j: 2005年4月1日、町全域が京都市右京区に編入したことで消滅した。
sen.e: On April 1, 2005, since the whole area of the town was absorbed into Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Keihoku-cho disappeared.
On April 1, 2005, since the whole area of the town was absorbed into Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Keihoku Town disappeared.
On April 1, 2005, since the whole area of the town was absorbed into Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Keihoku Town disappeared.
Geography
Geography
Geography

sen.j: 京都市に北接し、全域が丹波高原に含まれる。
sen.e: Keihoku-cho had contact with Kyoto City at the city's northern border, and the whole area of the town was in the Tanba highland.
sen.cmt: 原文は現在形ですが、既に無い町なので過去形で訳しました(他の箇所も同様です)。
sen.e: Keihoku Town had contact with Kyoto City at the city's northern border, and the whole area of the town was in the Tanba highland.
Keihoku Town had contact with Kyoto City at the city's northern border, and the whole area of the town was in the Tanba highland.

sen.e: The Kamikatsura-gawa River: The upper reaches of the Katsura-gawa River (the Yodo-gawa River system)

Industry

Forest industry
Forest industry
Forest industry

sen.j: 町域のほとんどが森林で、北山杉の磨丸太などの産地として林業が盛んである。
sen.e: Most areas of the town was forest, and the forest industry prospered as the production area of Migaki Maruta (polished log) of Kitayamasugi (Kitayama cedar trees) and so on.
Most areas of the town was forest, and the forest industry prospered as the production area of Migaki Maruta (polished log) of Kitayamasugi (Kitayama cedar trees) and so on.
Most areas of the town was forest, and the forest industry prospered as the production area of Migaki Maruta (polished log) of Kitayamasugi (Kitayama cedar trees) and so on.

sen.j: 町内を桂川 (淀川水系)が横断して京都嵯峨野などに接続しているため、古代より水運を利用した京都の重要な材木供給地であった。
sen.e: It was the main supply area of lumber to Kyoto from ancient times using water transport, because the Katsura-gawa River (the Yodo-gawa River system) crossed the town and connected to Sagano, Kyoto and so on.

It was the main supply area of lumber to Kyoto from ancient times using water transport, because the Katsura-gawa River (the Yodo-gawa River system) crossed the town and connected to Sagano, Kyoto and so on.

It was the main supply area of lumber to Kyoto from ancient times using water transport, because the Katsura-gawa River (the Yodo-gawa River system) crossed the town and connected to Sagano, Kyoto and so on.

May to June, 2002
May to June, 2002
May to June, 2002

sen.j: - 京都市への編入を要望する署名活動が行なわれ、町内有権者の8割を越える署名が集まる。
sen.e: Signatures by more than 80 percent of eligible voters of the town were collected through the signature campaign demanding the absorption into Kyoto City.
Signatures by more than 80 percent of eligible voters of the town were collected through the signature campaign demanding the absorption into Kyoto City.
Signatures by more than 80 percent of eligible voters of the town were collected through the signature campaign demanding the absorption into Kyoto City.
November 7, 2002
November 7, 2002
November 7, 2002

sen.j: - 署名を受け、京北町が京都市に対し編入合併を申出。
sen.e: Keihoku-cho offered Kyoto City the absorption in response to the signatures.
Keihoku Town offered Kyoto City the absorption in response to the signatures.
Keihoku Town offered Kyoto City the absorption in response to the signatures.

sen.j: - 京都市と京北町による法定合併協議会設置。
sen.e: The Legal Absorption Conference was organized by Kyoto City and Keihoku-cho.
The Legal Absorption Conference was organized by Kyoto City and Keihoku Town.

sen.j: - 法定合併協議会により合併が正式決定。
sen.e: The absorption was officially decided on by the Legal Absorption Conference.
The absorption was officially decided on by the Legal Absorption Conference.

sen.j: 京北町側の意志により、議員の定数特例不採用もあわせて決定。
sen.e: According to the will of Keihoku-cho, it was also decided not to apply the exception to the fixed number of assembly members.
According to the will of Keihoku Town, it was also decided not to apply the exception to the fixed number of assembly members.
